CatDescriptText: Jordan James, 113 Chalfont Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1958, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that there will be an economic depression in near future like the one in the early thirties?" answer reads: "I don't think so and the reason is because of unemployment compensation and the building program. However, I don't believe that things will be better in 30 days like Ike says.  Eventually, I think that they will get better, perhaps in April or May."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jordan James wearing dark hat, moustache, striped shirt, and dark knit zippered sweater, standing in front of marble pillar in corridor with store windows on either side
